item.title: Web Platform Daily: September 10th, 2013
item.description:
September 10th, 2013

  • News
    • Today: Responsive images meetup in Paris, source
    • Opera launches Coast, a web browser for iPad, @brucel’s post + optimizing web apps for Coast, page
    • The U.S. government tapped into computer networks of companies including Google, article (Reuters)
  • UA dev.
    • Firefox Scratchpad: Auto-fixing JavaScript typos (prototype), @valueof’s post
  • Tutorials
    • Ignoring library code while debugging in Chrome (like Firefox’s “black boxing”), @collintmiller’s post
    • Five helpful tips when using RequireJS (i.a. working with non-AMD libraries), @ifandelse’s post
  • Articles
    • Two responsive image approaches that require minimal developer effort, @borismus’s post
    • An ambitious proposal for a new responsive image format (includes prototype), @yoavweiss’s post
    • Building games that take advantage of HTML5 and the web platform, @austinhallock’s post
    • HTML5 video on mobile - considerations and troubleshooting, @aliciatweet’s post
  • Media
    • Testing Node.js applications with Jasmine, @clemenshelm’s 5-min screencast
    • Frontend security (i.a. Content Security Policy), mikewest’s 47-min talk (+ slides + transcript)
  • Content
    • Idea: Set Client-Hints (?) via <meta> tag, discussion on GitHub
    • A good visual overview of HTML elements (w/ links to MDN and W3C), @joshduck’s page
  • Demos
    • Cool effect: Image pixelation on hover, @pixelia_me’s demo
    • HelloRun, a visually impressive HTML5 game by @HelloEnjoy, play
  • Tools
    • URLcrypt (PHP port), a library for securely transmitting binary data in URLs, repo
    • Two.js, a render-agnostic 2D drawing API (draws in SVG, Canvas and WebGL), page
  • Opinion
    • “That PE thang” (progressive enhancement), @slightlylate’s post
